subject: RE: [junit] OT: Request for example -- boolean parameters
msgSnippet: ... Yeah, I really know this one. It gets really hard if that method is overloaded (that is, exists in a dozen variants) and you need to change the signature
messageBody:
> What I'd love is a real-life example of this, preferably from
> a well-known library. If anyone has, by chance, come across
> one of these monsters, I'd appreciate a reference.
>
> In other words, a method like doIt(myObject, anotherObject, true,
> false, true, true);
>
> What the hell does true, false, true, true mean?!

Yeah, I really know this one. It gets really hard if that method is
overloaded (that is, exists in a dozen variants) and you need to change
the signature (change a parameter, for example). A real nightmare... :(

I can't provide you the code, though - sorry.

Kind Regards, Ilja
